medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant and epigastric pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noticed right upper quadrant pain on the afternoon of the previous day, which has been steady since then. The pain radiates to the back and inferior left thorax. The patient experienced nausea yesterday but no vomiting, with anorexia since lunchtime yesterday. The pain was not associated with a meal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (IDDM), hypertension (HTN), headaches, arthritis, previous alcohol use several years ago, normal colonoscopy in the past.
